frqParts.text:
Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

The graph shows the percentage of electricity produced by nuclear energy in various countries from 1960 to 2015.

(a) Based on the information in the graph, describe the trend in the percentage of electricity produced using nuclear energy in France between 1980 and 1990.
(b) Based on the information in the graph, identify the most recent year in which Germany produced a greater percentage of its electricity from nuclear energy than did the United States.

(c) Throughout the 1990s, the United States used significantly more nuclear fuel than Germany. Explain how the United States could have used more nuclear fuel when the graph is showing similar trends for both countries.

(d) Researchers state that the 2011 Tohoku earthquake and tsunami in Japan had a positive impact on nuclear power generation in Japan after the event. Make a claim that supports or refutes this statement based on evidence in the graph.

Electrical production in the United States is typically produced in a power plant but can also be supplemented by renewable sources of energy as well.
(e) Describe why pairing wind energy with nuclear energy makes this renewable source a more viable method of electrical production for more United States consumers.
(f) Some heating systems in homes can endanger the lives of the occupants when not operating efficiently. Identify an indoor air pollutant that could cause this effect.

Urban forests, green roofs, parks, and other green spaces can improve environmental conditions for city dwellers in a number of ways.
(g) In addition to improving air quality and reducing energy usage in cities, increasing the amount of vegetation can decrease urban runoff. Describe one way increasing the amount of vegetation in cities can lead to decreased runoff.
(h) Describe one cultural benefit that may result from increasing the amount of vegetation in cities.
